contentrichtext.text: '''Xihu District''' ([[Chinese character|Chinese]]: 西湖区; [[Pinyin]]: Xinghú Qū), literally meaning "west lake district", is a district of [[Nanchang]], the capital of [[Jiangxi]] Province, [[China]]. The district was created in the [[Tang Dynasty]] when a bridge was built across Nanchang's Taihu lake, dividing the area into the East and West Lake districts. It covers over 39 square kilometers and as of 2004 had a population of 460,000. ==Administrative divisions== It is divided into 10 areas: *?jinta (绳金塔) *Taoyuan (桃源) *Chaoyangzhou (朝阳洲) *Guang?men (广润门) *Nanpu (南浦) *Xihu (西湖) *Simazhuang(系马桩) *Shizijie (十字街) *Dinggonglu (丁公路) *Nanzhan "South Station" (南站) and 1 town: *Taohuazhen (桃花镇) ==External links== *[http://www.ncxh.gov.cn/English/EnOverview.aspx Nanchang Xihu Government Web(English)] {{County-level divisions of Jiangxi}} {{coord|28|37|47|N|115|55|18|E|region:CN-36_type:adm2nd_source:kolossus-dewiki|display=title}} [[Category:Nanchang]] [[Category:County-level divisions of Jiangxi]] {{Jiangxi-geo-stub}}
